docs.lead_paragraph: AFTER school, the smokers head to the curb to light up. It's the same curb smokers at Elizabeth High School have used forever -- across the street from the Dunn Sports Center, in front of the corner grocery. "A habit, I guess," said one of the smokers, dragging long and hard on a Camel. We'll call him Joe. Anything more, he said, could get him in trouble. His mother would throw a fit if she found out he was smoking (again). The first time she caught him, he forfeited his $15 allowance for two weeks. The next time, the penalty would be harsher. "She'd tell my father," Joe said.

headline.main: Our Towns;Calls for Bans As Students Keep Puffing
